column5:
Latest news:

International Restrictions:
*From within the EU: COVID-19 travel restrictions were lifted in Czechia. Travellers are not required to provide proof of vaccination, recovery from COVID-19 or a negative test result.

*Transit:

COVID-19 travel restrictions were lifted in Czechia. Travellers are not required to provide proof of vaccination, recovery from COVID-19 or a negative test result.

Learn more:

COVID-19 Portal



*From Third Countries:

COVID-19 travel restrictions were lifted in Czechia. Travellers are not required to provide proof of vaccination, recovery from COVID-19 or a negative test result.

Learn more:

COVID-19 Portal
Ministry of Interior


______________________

You can find the latest information on air travel regulations for this country on the IATA website.

You can also find information about your passenger rights on our portal for citizens.

Documents you need to travel in Europe
Health cover for temporary stays



Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in the Czech Republic: There are some measures in place to control the spread of coronavirus. The details of these measures can be found in the sections below.
*Public spaces and services: There are currently no restrictive measures in place. You can find details on organising public gatherings and the operation of shops, services and restaurants in English on the Czech government COVID portal.
